Dear Mr. McCree:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing, on the CWL-4617 within 15 days, with
submission of the corrective action plan. If you do not submit the CWL-4617, it will be
treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a provisional license, you must
still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 slammed Youth A's head to the ground during an incident
that occurred on 01/02/2025.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 01/07/2025 with DHHS
Worker 1 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility
and no additional information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed on 01/07/2025 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Youth A
described his current injury to the back of his head, stating that he
had been struck by another youth about a week prior. This
resulted in getting staples to address the wound. Since that time,
he admitted to picking at the wound, causing it to open up and
bleed on occasions. Youth A described the incident in
question. He reported being in a classroom with Staff 1, Staff 2,
Staff 3 and Supervisor 1. He was in the classroom with these staff
because they were attempting to help him calm down. Youth A
recalled Staff 2 antagonizing him. Youth A stated to Staff 2 “Can
you leave me alone?” and Staff 2 replied “No.” He repeatedly
asked Staff 2 if Staff 2 could leave the room and leave him
alone. Youth A recalled getting more and more upset, leading to
Youth A repeatedly attempting to assault Staff 2. As this was
occurring Youth A recalled hearing Staff 2 state “Want to hit me
again?” Youth A continued to try to assault Staff 2. He believed
at one point Staff 2’s leg was behind him, causing Youth A to fall
backwards to the ground and hit the back of his head. Youth A
believed Staff 2’s hand was on Youth A’s forehead as he laid on
the ground. He recalled being in pain and he knew the wound on
the back of his head was bleeding. As a result, Youth A stopped
2

trying to assault Staff 2 and remembered seeing other staff push
Staff 2 out of the room. He also recalled hearing Staff 3 tell Staff 2
to leave and go “up front.”
Nurse 1 was interviewed on 01/07/2025 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. She saw
Youth A the day following the incident, and stated Youth A had
been to the hospital the previous day after the incident to receive
care for the wound on the back of his head. Nurse 1 recalled
Youth A stated he had consistently been picking at the staples
used to treat the wound on his head. At the time she saw Youth
A’s wound was bleeding again slightly, and she recalled the
hospital had documented that it was not bleeding upon discharge
the prior night.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/07/2025 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. She
recalled being in the classroom with Youth A. Staff 1 stated she,
Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4 and Supervisor 1 were all in the classroom
with Youth A because he had previously been getting upset at
another youth and they made efforts to separate Youth A and
allow him a chance to deescalate. Staff 1 recalled Youth A
continued to get more and more upset and directed this mainly at
Staff 2. Along with attempting to hit and kick Staff 2, Staff 1
recalled Youth A throwing items like chairs as well. Staff 1
recalled attempting to help restrain Youth A, only to see him fall to
the ground. Staff 1 denied Youth A was tripped, causing him to
fall. Staff 1 described Youth A’s fall as a result of being pushed off
of Staff 2 as Youth A charged at Staff 2. Staff 1 stated Staff 2 did
not have a hand on Youth A as he fell or when he was on the
ground. At that point Youth A stopped trying to attack Staff 2.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed separately on 01/07/2025
with DHHS Worker 1 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to
the facility. They both stated they were not present for the incident
itself but were aware of what had occurred. Youth B and Youth C
both expressed no concerns with Staff 2 and his work with youth
in the facility. They denied ever seeing him push or hit youth.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 01/09/2025 over the phone with
DHHS Worker 1. Supervisor 1 recalled being a part of the effort to
help deescalate Youth A inside of a classroom. Supervisor 1
described Youth A’s behavior as escalating further, specifically
threatening and posturing at Staff 2. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth
A falling to the floor one last time when he charged at Staff 2. She
described the fall as being caused by Staff 2 pushing Youth A to
3

the ground. Supervisor 1 stated the push was not forceful, but he
did push Youth A “kind of hard.” Supervisor 1 saw blood pooling
on the ground beneath the back of Youth A’s head almost
immediately. She believed this was caused by Youth A’s
continued picking at his previous wound and the wound had
already been bleeding prior to the fall to the ground.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 01/09/2025 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. Staff 2 recalled being in the classroom with Youth
A. Youth A was never deescalated from what Staff 2 recalled, and
his behavior included cussing at and threatening the staff
involved. Staff 2 recalled Youth A attempting to assault him
several times. He would hit or kick at Staff 2 and when Staff 2 and
Staff 4 attempted to stop him or restrain him, Youth A would fall to
the ground. Staff 2 believed he was unable to leave the room
because there were no Safety Security Coordinators in the room
with them until Staff 4 came in. Staff 2 recalled Youth A charging
at him and then falling to the ground. Staff 2 stated he did have
the best recollection as to how that occurred. Staff 2 recalled
having his hands out and open as Youth A came at him while
attempting to hit Staff 2. He recalled leaving the room at that point
because Youth A was not attempting to assault Staff 2 anymore
after falling to the ground for the final time.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 01/09/2025 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. Staff 3 recalled Youth A’s escalated behavior while she
was in the classroom with him. She stated another staff called her
out of the classroom and when she left Youth A was verbally
escalated but the situation had not turned physical to that
point. Staff 3 recalled Youth A getting upset specifically at Staff
2. At one point he stated, “If you don’t get me out of here, then I
know how to get out of here.” She did not go back into the
classroom with Youth A after that.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 01/09/2025 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. He recalled being called into the classroom to assist
with the de-escalation effort of Youth A. Staff 4 recalled Youth A
hitting his own head on a desk and yelling threatening statements
before he attempted to attack Staff 2 several times. Youth A also
was picking at the wound on the back of his head as this was
occurring. Staff 4 recalled seeing Youth A throw chairs and
attempt to hit and kick staff. Staff 4 recalled Youth A falling to the
floor a final time and in doing so, Youth A hit the back of his head
and began to bleed on the floor. Staff 4 could not recall if Youth A
fell to the floor because he was pushed or shoved by Staff 2,
stating he did not see how this occurred. Staff 4 recalled Youth
4

A’s behavior immediately changing at this point and he stopped
being physically aggressive. Staff 4 recalled efforts to get the
injury on the back of his head addressed at that time.
Video reviewed:
Security camera footage dated 01/02/2025 was reviewed. At
6:41pm Youth A could be seen sitting in a classroom with Staff 2,
Staff 3, Staff 4, and Supervisor 1. Youth A could be heard
directing verbally aggressive language towards the staff. As
everyone was sitting in chairs, Youth A got up and attempted to hit
Staff 2 as Supervisor 1 attempted to get in between them. Staff 4
attempted a restraint of Youth A from behind. As this occurred
Youth A attempted to kick Staff 2. While Staff 4 still attempted to
gain control of Youth A from behind, Staff 2 pushed Youth A’s side
and Youth A fell to the floor in a sitting position. Staff 2 and Staff 4
approached Youth A and Youth A attempted to kick at Staff
2. Staff 2 and Staff 4 attempted to pick up Youth A only for him to
continue to struggle and stay on the ground. As this was
occurring Youth A could be heard yelling. Staff 2 and 4 attempted
to speak to him but the audio was not clear enough to determine
who was speaking and what was said. All four staff were
attempting to grab Youth A’s arms and legs while he was in a
sitting position. Staff 2 held Youth A’s right wrist and Staff 4 held
Youth A’s left wrist and they lifted him off the ground. Youth A
then kicked up towards Staff 2. Supervisor 1 knelt on the ground
and attempted to hold Youth A’s legs as he was in a seated
position. Staff 2 pulled up on Youth A’s right wrist, causing Youth
A to briefly be lifted off the ground. Youth A continued to yell in
pain. Either Staff 2 or Staff 4 could be heard asking Youth A to
relax.
As Youth A yelled about his arm and being in pain, he pulled his
hand away from Staff 2’s grasp. Staff 2 attempted to grab ahold
of Youth A’s arm or shoulders from behind, but the view was
slightly obscured by Staff 3. Staff 2 was able to pull Youth A from
behind by his shirt sleeves while in a seated position. Supervisor
3 could be heard asking Youth A to stop. Staff 2 then attempted
to grab and pull on Youth A from behind. Youth A then laid on the
ground. The staff disengaged and let go of Youth A. Youth A
kicked towards Staff 2, then crawled on the ground and found an
unidentifiable item to throw at Staff 2. Staff 2 could be seen
holding the left hand of Youth A while Youth A continued to
struggle, appearing to kick Supervisor 1 near her face. Staff 2
held on to Youth A’s left leg and dragged him towards the
door. As this was occurring Staff 4 was attempting to hold on to
Youth A’s upper body while Youth A was on his back on the
5

ground. Staff 2 then held on to one of Youth A’s arms and
attempted to lift him off the ground. As Youth A’s position within
the room moved towards the exit door his body was obscured by
the staff standing near him. He got back up on his feet and
punched at Staff 2, and then fell to the ground. Staff 2 reached
down towards Youth A and Staff 3, Staff 4 and Supervisor 1 then
crowded around them near the exit door. Staff 2 knelt down
towards Youth A and was physically engaged with him, but it
could not be determined how. Youth A could be heard yelling
again. Staff 2 and Staff 4 appeared to struggle with Youth A as he
was in a seated position. Staff 2 held one of Youth A’s arms and
drug him away from the doorway. Youth A was in a prone position
on the ground and grabbed onto Staff 2’s right leg as Staff 4
followed behind them.
Staff 2 then knelt and appeared to hold his left hand near the neck
or head area of Youth A, holding Youth A’s head to the ground as
he looked to his left. Staff 2 then stood up and stepped back from
Youth A, with the other three staff attempting to physically engage
Youth A while he was still in a prone position on the floor. Youth A
then attempted to grab something on Supervisor 1’s left hip as
Supervisor 1 knelt near him. Staff could be heard telling Youth A
to stop what he was doing. While lying in a prone position staff
attempted to remove an item from Youth A’s hand and moved a
trash can away from him. Staff 2 was seen picking up Youth A’s
arms while he was laying on the ground and throwing them back
to the ground. Youth A could be heard yelling in response. Youth
A then attempted to crawl towards and reach at Staff 2 while Staff
3 had her hand on the back of his shirt attempting to prevent him
from reaching Staff 2. Staff 3 let go of Youth A’s shirt, leaving him
on the ground with no one else in contact with him. Youth A
stayed on the ground in a prone position for about 30 seconds and
could be heard screaming at Staff 2 and asking him to leave the
room.
Youth A stood up and grabbed a nearby chair, attempting to throw
it at Staff 2. Staff 4 was able to block this attempt. Youth A
pushed Staff 3 from behind as Staff 4 interacted with him. Youth
A punched at Staff 4, picked up another chair, and attempted to
throw it. Staff 4 wrapped his arms around Youth A’s right side,
torso area. As Staff 2 approached him Youth A attempted to kick
Staff 2, then proceeded to fall to the ground in a sitting
position. Staff 4 attempted to hold Youth A’s left arm from behind
him while he was in a seated position on the ground. As this
occurred Staff 2 reached his arms forward and made contact with
Youth A’s shoulder or head area, causing Youth A’s upper body to
6

fall backwards to the ground. Youth A was then on his left side on
the ground and Staff 4 continued to hold on to Youth A’s left wrist
with his arm extended. Staff 2 was in a crouched position above
Youth A and at one point had his left hand on the side of Youth
A’s head. At that point Youth A’s head was not touching the
ground. Staff could be heard continuing to ask Youth A to stop
what he was doing. All four staff were physically engaged with
Youth A as he sat up from the ground. Youth A wrapped his legs
around Staff 2’s right leg and Staff 2 attempted to step away from
him. Staff 2 was able to remove his leg from Youth A’s
grasp. The security camera footage experienced a small glitch,
then showing Youth A turned on to his front on the ground as Staff
3 and Staff 4 stood above him. Staff 3 had her hand on the back
of his shirt at that time. Staff 3 let go of Youth A and he stayed in
the same position on the ground for several seconds, only to then
get up. Youth A reached towards Staff 2. Staff 2 attempted to
block Youth A with his arms and Youth A was able to punch Staff
2 in the facial area. Staff 2 wrapped his arms around Youth A
from behind and threw Youth A to the ground. Youth A’s head
could be seen hitting the ground, and he immediately grabbed at
the back of his head. Staff 2 reached down to grab on to Youth A
and attempted to pull him up from the ground. Supervisor 1
attempted to intervene and separate Staff 2 from Youth A. Youth
A was heard screaming. Staff 2 released his hands from Youth A
as he was halfway up from the ground and Youth A fell back to the
ground on his back. Youth A kicked up towards Staff 2 as Staff 2
was within reach. Youth A screamed. Staff 3 appeared to
address Staff 2 separately, but it could not be heard what either
said to each other. Supervisor 1 knelt near Youth A and Staff 4
stood on the opposite side of Youth A as he was laying on the
ground, yelling obscenities. Staff 3 grabbed Staff 2 by the
shoulder and guided him out of the room.
As this occurred Youth A was still laying on the ground and could
be heard stating he was in pain as Supervisor 1 and Staff 4 stayed
nearby. Blood was then seen beginning to pool underneath Youth
A’s head. This was the end of Youth A’s escalated behavior and
staff’s physical intervention with him. The entire incident was
approximately six minutes.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility Incident Report documentation dated 01/02/2025
and authored by Supervisor 1 was provided and
reviewed. This documentation contained consistent
elements with interviews provided for why Youth A was in
the classroom and how his behavior escalated into
7

attempting to assault Staff 2. It then described Youth A’s
fall to the floor without stating how this occurred.
• Medical documentation for Youth A’s visit to the hospital on
01/02/2025. This documentation described the additional
bleeding to the laceration on Youth A’s scalp that occurred
after the incident in question. It also included a description
of right forearm pain caused by Youth A’s disclosure of
hitting his arm against a wall of a shower door in the
bathroom of his pod, which occurred prior to the incident in
question. Youth A was provided over-the-counter pain
medication and discharged back to the facility in the early
morning hours of 01/03/2025.
• Facility medical progress note dated 01/03/2025 and
authored by Nurse 1 was provided and reviewed. In this
documentation Youth A disclosed having his head
slammed to the ground by Staff 2 during the incident in
question.
• Facility policy on youth discipline and behavior
management was provided and reviewed. This
documentation outlined prohibited conduct from staff to
youth, including any type of physical discipline.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, documentation and video reviewed staff had
aggressive physical contact with Youth A throughout the incident.
Youth A was pushed down several times, arms pulled by several
staff multiple times, dragged at least twice, once by the leg and
once by the arms, and thrown to the ground by Staff 2.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code Emergency restraint
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160
Section The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(b) When all other interventions in the agency's crisis prevention
and intervention plan and the youth's individual safety and
calming plan have been utilized but fail to protect the youth or
others from unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that
places the youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury
if no immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 2 did not remove himself from the situation when available to
do so, allowing Youth A to further escalate.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed on 01/07/2025 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He
recalled repeatedly expressing that his escalated nature during
the incident was directed solely at Staff 2 as he felt antagonized
by Staff 2. Youth A requested multiple times during the incident
for Staff 2 to leave the situation.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 01/09/2025 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. Staff 2 believed Youth A tried attacking only him and
was upset largely at him alone during the incident. Staff 2 stated
staying in the room while Youth A continually was escalated by his
presence was a necessity, because he was the only Safety &
Security Coordinator in the room until Staff 4 came in to assist in
the situation. Staff 2 clarified that the Safety & Security
Coordinator role was one that was assigned to direct care staff to
assist with escalated situations. Staff 2 recalled leaving the
situation after Youth A stopped attacking him and he was
requested to do so by Staff 3.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 01/09/2025 over the phone with
DHHS Worker 1. She recalled Youth A directing his anger
specially at Staff 2 during the incident. Supervisor 1 recalled
Youth A threatening Staff 2 several times during the incident. She
did not recall any efforts or threats from Youth A to any of the
other staff involved in the incident.
9

Staff 4 was interviewed on 01/09/2025 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. Staff 4 recalled Youth A’s physically aggressive
behavior during the incident as solely targeted at Staff 2.
Video reviewed:
Security camera footage dated 01/02/2025 was reviewed. During
the approximately six minutes of Youth A’s escalated behavior
and repeated attempts at physical intervention of Youth A, he
continued to verbally and physically attack Staff 2. Staff 4 was
present in the room during the entirety of the incident. At no point
in time did Staff 2 attempt to leave the situation. Youth A was
heard asking for Staff 2 to leave multiple times. There were
several points during the incident where Youth A was on the
ground after a restraint attempt or attempt to attack Staff 2 with
staff still standing very near him or having physical contact with
him.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy on youth discipline and behavior
management was provided and reviewed. This
documentation outlined the required elements of staff
intervention to be used prior to the use of physical
intervention, including that “a safe physical intervention
shall be used only as a last resort, after all other methods
of non-physical intervention have been exhausted.”
• Facility policy titled “Crisis Counseling” was provided and
reviewed. This policy & procedure provided instruction for
staff in the form of a continuum of verbal interaction with
youth as youth escalate. This included advising staff to use
emotional support techniques such as non-verbal and para-
verbal support skills and active listening to de-escalate
youth.
• Safety plan documentation from the facility regarding Youth
A was provided and reviewed. Youth A had previously self-
identified that warning signs that he would be getting upset
were yelling and clenching his fist. Included in the plan
were staff that he felt that he could speak to were Staff 4
and Supervisor 1.
• Facility job description documentation titled “Safety and
Support Coordinator” (also referred to as a SSC) was
provided and reviewed. This detailed the responsibilities of
that position, which included Staff 2 and Staff 4 in this
incident. This documented SSC responsibilities including
responding to all emergency situations, performing and
supervising restraints as a situation requires. This
documentation did not direct SSCs to ensure that one of
10

these staff are involved in an escalated situation at all
times.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, document and video reviewed all staff involved did not
exhaust all possible alternatives to physical intervention. Staff 2
continued to be involved in the situation despite Youth A’s
targeted escalation towards him and having available staff to
intervene without his presence, as well as the proximity of staff to
the youth during several points of the incident and continued
attempts to make physical contact with Youth A during points in
time that he was not physically aggressive.
TECHINCAL ASSISTANCE:
The facility is advised to assess the effectiveness of current de-
escalation training and policy and procedure to ensure staff have
the tools to utilize all least restrictive interventions.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth's behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition, medical
condition, psychiatric condition, and personal history, including
any history of trauma, and must be done in a manner
consistent with the youth's treatment plan.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff used unapproved restraint holds on Youth A.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed on 01/07/2025 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Youth A
recalled some of the staff, of which he could not specify,
attempting to prevent him from getting to Staff 2. He believed he
was restrained at points but stated the situation was chaotic and
that he was very upset, causing his own memory to not be clear.
11

Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/07/2025 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 1
believed it was Staff 2 and Staff 4 who first attempted to restrain
Youth A as Youth A assaulted Staff 2. She recalled attempting to
help with restraints, including attempting to hold one of Youth A’s
arms while Staff 2 and Staff 4 were already physically engaged
with him. Staff 1 believed this was brief and she was
unsuccessful in doing so.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 01/09/2025 over the phone with
DHHS Worker 1. Supervisor 1 took part in restraint attempts of
Youth A as he attempted to hit and kick Staff 2. She recalled
these attempts being short and chaotic as Youth A would attempt
to assault Staff 2 but then fall to the floor when staff attempted to
stop him. Supervisor 1 noted that the facility did not allow restraint
attempts while youth were on the floor.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 01/09/2025 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. He recalled attempting to perform restraints with Youth
A during the incident. Staff 2 believed that any time this was tried
Youth A fell to the ground, which meant he had to disengage from
Youth A. Staff 2 recalled that Staff 4 was attempting to assist him
with these physical management efforts of Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 01/09/2025 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. He stated Staff 2 assisted him in attempting to restrain
Youth A. Staff 4 described the situation as chaotic. Staff 4
described these restraint attempts as frequent and unsuccessful in
that Youth A would commonly fall to the floor and staff would
release their hold of him.
Video reviewed:
• Security camera footage dated 01/02/2025 was
reviewed. At several points during the video restraints are
attempted of Youth A. Staff 4 specifically attempted to
restrain Youth A multiple times on his own by holding Youth
A’s arms behind his body while standing behind Youth
A. In addition, there were several instances within the
video footage where staff attempted to physically engage
with Youth A while he was laying on the floor. Staff 4 also
attempted to restraint Youth A from his right side by
reaching over his shoulder.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy on youth discipline and behavior
management was provided and reviewed. This
12

documentation stated that “only the approved [facility] safe
physical management techniques may be used.”
• Training materials for the facility’s approved restraint model
were provided and reviewed. The restraint holds that are
trained through the MANDT system are as follows:
o Loose hold where two staff position themselves
behind a youth while holding a youth’s arms outward
from their body while all individuals are standing.
o Secure hold where two staff stand behind a youth,
holding the youth’s arms from behind while he or she
stands. They then move the youth’s forearms near
his or her body to gain further control.
o One-Person side body hold where a staff attempts to
hold the body of the youth from the side while both
are standing.
o Two-person side body hold where another staff
replicates the same position of the other staff
involved in a one-person side body hold.
o One-arm hold where a staff stands behind a
standing youth and reaches under the youth’s arms
to hold on to the youth’s wrists in front of their body.
o Two-arm hold that is the same as the one-arm hold,
with the staff holding both of the youth’s wrists in
front of the youth’s body.
o Two-person one-arm hold that replicates the same
effort as the one-arm hold with a staff on either side
of a standing youth.
• Training records for the following staff were reviewed:
o Staff 2 was up-to-date on the facility’s approved
restraint model training as of 08/30/2024 for the
“Physical Skills” portion of the approved restraint
model for the facility and 09/16/2024 for the “Verbal
De-Escalation Techniques” portion.
o Staff 4 was up-to-date on the facility’s approved
restraint model training as of 08/30/2024 for the
“Physical Skills” portion and 09/16/2024 for the
“Verbal De-Escalation Techniques” portion.
o Staff 3 was up-to-date on the facility’s approved
restraint model training as of 08/30/2024 for the
“Physical Skills” portion and 05/30/2024 for the
“Verbal De-Escalation Techniques” portion.
